channel.title: Iphone on Mark Cherrie
channel.description: Recent content in Iphone on Mark Cherrie

item.title: How to process information gathered on your mobile to get information on everyday exposure to greenspace?
item.description: Background Spending time in the natural environment (green and blue spaces) is linked with better health outcomes throughout life (Douglas). From prenatal/pregnancy, childhood, adolescence to adulthood and later adulthood, we benefit from more social interaction, less stress, more physical activity, more diverse microbial exposure from being in these places. One of the key questions facing ‘lifecourse of place’ studies is trying to determine when these places matter most for a variety of health outcomes or whether it is the accumulation of time spent in these areas that is important.
